dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev just made a really strong statement about language rights in Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev just made a really strong statement about language rights in Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev has emphasized that no one in Kazakhstan has the right to tell citizens which language to speak—whether in private or in public.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, he was speaking at the Assembly of the People of Kazakhstan, right? Emphasizing that no one can tell citizens what language to use, in public or private.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, he was speaking at the Assembly of the People of Kazakhstan, right? Emphasizing that no one can tell citizens what language to use, in public or private.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Any attempts to incite division over this issue will be firmly dealt with in accordance with the law, he said during a session of the Assembly of the People of Kazakhstan. It goes without saying that in Kazakhstan, no one is entitled to dictate what language people should speak in personal conversations or public settings.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And he mentioned a pretty striking number—80 percent of graduates now take their national testing in Kazakh. That's a huge shift, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And he mentioned a pretty striking numberminus eighty percent of graduates now take their national testing in Kazakh. That's a huge shift, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tokayev pointed out that around 80 percent of graduates now take the Unified National Testing in the state language, and over 70 percent of first-grade students this year are beginning their education in Kazakh.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It is! And over 70 percent of first-graders are starting school in Kazakh this year too. That shows how the language landscape is evolving organically.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It is! And over seventy percent of first-graders are starting school in Kazakh this year too. That shows how the language landscape is evolving organically.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tokayev pointed out that around 80 percent of graduates now take the Unified National Testing in the state language, and over 70 percent of first-grade students this year are beginning their education in Kazakh.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But he was also firm on cracking down on anyone trying to stir up division, like, domestically or from abroad. He called out foreign-funded provocateurs specifically.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But he was also firm on cracking down on anyone trying to stir up division, like, domestically or from abroad. He called out foreign-funded provocateurs specifically.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And by provocateurs, I'm referring not only to those operating domestically but also to those engaged in destructive activities from abroad, often funded by foreign organizations, the President said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and he tied it back to those core values from last year's National Kurultai—unity, patriotism, independence, harmony. Really grounding it in something bigger.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and he tied it back to those core values from last year's National Kurultai-unity, patriotism, independence, harmony. Really grounding it in something bigger.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He reminded the audience that during last year's National Kurultai, Kazakhstan's core values were laid out: unity, patriotism, independence, and harmony.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and he made it clear: work toward unity, you're respected; try to divide, you face the law. No ambiguity there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and he made it clear: work toward unity, you're respected; try to divide, you face the law. No ambiguity there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I want to reiterate: those who attempt to divide and fracture society will be held fully accountable under the law and face inevitable punishment. But those who work toward unity and harmony will always be held in high regard, Tokayev added.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: This was the 34th session of the Assembly, wasn't it? And it's their 30th anniversary this year—pretty significant timing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: This was the thirty fourth session of the Assembly, wasn't it? And it's their thirtieth anniversary this year-pretty significant timing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier, on March 20, President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev convened the 34th session of the Assembly of the People of Kazakhstan. This year marks the 30th anniversary of the APK.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. And Dmitry Ostankovich, the deputy chair, called it a key platform for bringing different cultures together around shared values.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. And Dmitry Ostankovich, the deputy chair, called it a key platform for bringing different cultures together around shared values.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The APK is a key public platform that brings together people of different nationalities, cultures, and traditions around shared Kazakhstani values, said Deputy Chairman of the APK Dmitry Ostankovich earlier.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: I like how he framed it—not just preserving heritage, but fostering mutual respect and civic responsibility. That's proactive.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I like how he framed it-not just preserving heritage, but fostering mutual respect and civic responsibility. That's proactive.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to him, the assembly's role goes beyond preserving cultural heritage — it fosters an atmosphere of mutual respect, civic responsibility, and unity.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And Tokayev chairs the Assembly himself, which shows how central this is to his vision for the country.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Tokayev chairs the Assembly himself, which shows how central this is to his vision for the country.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The President of Kazakhstan serves as the Chair of the APK.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Makes sense, especially with his focus on social harmony amid all the changes happening there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Makes sense, especially with his focus on social harmony amid all the changes happening there.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. You get the sense they're really intentional about building cohesion, not just tolerating diversity.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. You get the sense they're really intentional about building cohesion, not just tolerating diversity.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and grounding it in law and values, not just rhetoric. Smart approach.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and grounding it in law and values, not just rhetoric. Smart approach.
